review: If you are committed to the Apple ecosystem, the Apple TV (latest version) is a must have.  It allows you to stream all of your content from your main computer iTunes account to your TV in a superlative manner.  Additionally, you can stream purchased content directly from the iTunes store -- if you have purchased the content from Apple, you can stream it if you have a sufficiently fast internet service.  The newest software version of this device also allows you to access certain other content providers including Netflix.  Unfortunately but not surprisingly, this device does not allow you to access your Amazon Video-on-Demand account, which is truly a shame.  Nonetheless, this device does a lot and does it extremely well.I have been using Apple TVs since the second version, and it has come a long way.  This latest version unfortunately does away with the on-board hard-disk, which allowed one to place content directly on the Apple TV.  This was helpful for use in boats or RVs, where you might not have WiFi, internet, or the ability to stream from an iTunes computer.  On the other hand, the setup and use of this device is almost completely intuitive, and there is essentially no real setup procedure to speak of.  The device goes into sleep mode after being idle for a time, but simply click the remote and it immediately wakes up.  This works perfectly and effectively, and cures the grip that everyone had with the earlier Apple TVs, which was that they always ran warm, causing users to question the service life of the component.Overall, this is an elegantly engineered and well thought-out accessory that is a pleasure to use.  If iTunes is the major source of your content, this device is nearly perfect.  If not, you can still stream Netflix and certain other content providers, but it is somewhat limited in this regards.  RJB.
